Frog-march

FROGMARCH verb [mid-19th century and still in use] to carry someone face down, one person holding onto each limb; used on drunks or recalcitrant prisoners. In case your wonder, the term was used by Joseph Wilson to in reference to alleged leaks by senior White House officials, exposing his wife as an undercover CIA operative specializing in...
